metadata.title: CVE-2021-35942 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 maycrash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) whencalled with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in adenial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoiwas used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.3+esm2').
